author: @kjzzphoenix
title: Arizona lawmakers advance bill to create partisan school board races | KJZZ
text: AZ lawmakers advance bill to create partisan school board races Republican lawmakers advanced a bill that would make nonpartisan school board races partisan. And the bill’s sponsor says she wants even more elections to feature politically partisan candidates. [Senate Bill 1097 would require school board candidates to disclose their party affiliation ](https://www.azleg.gov/legtext/56leg/2R/bills/SB1097P.pdf)to voters — something school officials, like the Arizona School Boards Association, and legislative Democrats oppose. But Sen. Justine Wadsack (R-Tucson) says she wants to take the idea even further because it lets voters make more informed decisions. “We should have partisan, maybe, partisan judges, maybe we should do partisan everybody, because right now the world is split, I think, and you have people that want to live their lives by one ideology and others that want to live by another, and they get to choose,” Wadsack said. “Where they want to be where they want to live where they send their children, which fire district they go to; all of that is determined by political ideology,” she said, later adding that city elections should also be partisan. Barry Aarons, a lobbyist for the Arizona Association of County School Superintendents, said that the bill would unnecessarily polarize local elections. “If you have a partisan designation it restricts you because you become slavishly devoted to your partisan base, and it restricts you on coming up with consensus on issues and school board issues should be consensus issues not partisan battlegrounds,” he said. [A similar measure sponsored by former GOP lawmaker Michelle Ugenti-Rita](https://www.azleg.gov/legtext/55leg/2R/bills/SB1010P.pdf) failed to clear its first hearing vote in 2022, when then Republican Sen. Tyler Pace voted against the bill alongside Democrats. Wadsack’s version of the bill passed its first hearing Wednesday on party lines. It is co-sponsored by the Senate president and seven other Republicans. Democrats who voted against SB 1097 raised the issue of replacing school board members. In partisan elections, if the office holder leaves their position for any reason, their appointed replacement must be from the same political party. Sen. Christine Marsh (D-Phoenix) said she’s concerned that adding party affiliation to the school board candidates would further narrow the pool of replacements if an elected member leaves office. There are more than 200 Arizona school districts, and Sen. Ken Bennett (R-Prescott) said sometimes it’s difficult to field enough candidates, especially in rural areas. “Sometimes you’re looking for a warm body to replace someone,” Bennett said. Wadsack disagreed. She said the vacancy issue is just “the possibility of something that might happen” and not something that should impact lawmaking, especially since parents in her experience are more engaged than usual in school board activity. Wadsack said that partisan school board elections in other states lead to higher turnout, citing a conservative think tank. The Foundation for Government Accountability [released a study in 2023 on North Carolina,](https://thefga.org/research/north-carolina-evidence-school-board-candidates-party-affiliation/) where there are both partisan and nonpartisan school board elections. Chris Kotterman with the Arizona School Board Association said it makes sense that voters would select whatever candidate matches their party all the way down the ballot, but said that’s not necessarily a good thing. He called partisan elections “bruising affairs” that he doesn’t want to subject the candidates to. “I don’t think extending that level of rancor downward is an appropriate solution to the problem,” Kotterman said.

author: @WHSVnews
title: Stuarts Draft Farm thankful for rainfall
text: Stuarts Draft Farm thankful for rainfall STUARTS DRAFT, Va. (WHSV) - Augusta County produce farm says the recent rain has been a blessing. Cassidy Fitzgerald, Co-owner of Simply Rooted Farm said the farm has not had much moisture and the rain that came has helped. Co-owner Madison Davis said there was only a little bit of wind damage. “Luckily, we didn’t have too much wind damage if any at all, it blew over some sunflowers and maybe a couple corn plants but nothing too harmful,” Davis said. Davis and Fitzgerald said the dry weather has not been good for fruit production or fruit health. Davis added that even the plants that prefer dryer weather were not getting enough moisture. ”We grow a ten-acre field by hand, and we have no way to irrigate so we are thankful for this now,” Davis said. While getting too much rain can cause damage to the crops, other than a few baby corn plants that were covered, the rain has caused more good than bad. Simply Rooted Farm’s main crop right now is sweet corn, which typically grows better with about an inch of rain per week, which it hasn’t been getting, Davis said. Copyright 2024 WHSV. All rights reserved.

author: Nicole Massabrook
title: Sarah Michelle Gellar Is 'Realistic' With Phone and iPad Limits for Her Kids | Flipboard
text: Sarah Michelle Gellar has handled vampires, werewolves and more on screen with ease, but off screen, protecting her two kids is harder when they have so much technology at their fingertips. “There’s parts of [technology] that are great, and there are parts of it that aren’t,” Gellar, 46, told Us Weekly while promoting her partnership with UScellular for the Global Day of Unplugging, which is on Friday, March 1. “I love the idea that I know where they are at all times because it shows up on my phone. I took two crosstown buses in New York City to get to school. My mom had no idea where I was, and I can’t even imagine what that must’ve been like for her.” The Buffy the Vampire Slayer alum shares daughter Charlotte, 14, and son Rocky, 11, with her husband of nearly 22 years, Freddie Prinze Jr. The pair set strict rules for their kids when it comes to internet access and their devices, but that doesn’t mean just restricting screen time as a whole. “Look, we had rain for five days. What do I expect these kids to do?” Gellar said. “I want to be realistic with them about their time.” See Sarah Michelle Gellar and Freddie Prinze Jr. Get in the Spooky Spirit That means establishing some guidelines. Gellar said that their kids first have to wait until finishing elementary school to get their own phone. “You have to graduate lower school to get your phone, so my son actually will be getting his phone in June,” Gellar explained to Us. “He does not have one yet. He has an iPad for travel and stuff like that.” The Do Revenge star also takes full advantage of the parental controls when she lets one of her children use a tablet or phone, monitoring how many hours they spend in front of the screen and what they’re looking at. “We can’t expect kids to be able to self-regulate, right? That’s something that we’re still learning how to do [as adults],” she said. Though Gellar can control the devices she buys for their kids, she can’t control other kids and their phones — which can lead to some awkward situations. Gellar was shocked when one of Rocky’s friends with a phone once showed him something on the internet about her. ‘Buffy the Vampire Slayer’ Cast: Where Are They Now? “It was actually my son one day who came home and said, oh, so-and-so has a phone or something. They looked it up and we had to explain that you can’t do that,” she recalled, adding that the school has some protections in place. “A lot of the school computers in the lower school, you actually can’t look up a lot of … More stories from [Us Weekly](/@usweekly) Join the flipboard community Discover, collect, and share stories for all your interests [Sign up](/signup) More stories from [Sarah Michelle Gellar](/topic/sarahmichellegellar) [Danica McKellar Crushed On Fred Savage During The Wonder Years, But Did They Ever Hook Up?](/topic/sarahmichellegellar/danica-mckellar-crushed-on-fred-savage-during-the-wonder-years-but-did-they-eve/a-kwZIoYY4SR6DuYF6-QG1TA%3Aa%3A3039078443-9ce348a205%2Fthethings.com) When Danica McKellar and Fred Savage played love interests Winnie and Kevin on The Wonder Years, did sparks fly behind the scenes? We receive compensation when you click on a link and make a purchase. Learn more! author: admin3
title: Nicarágua expulsa sete sacerdotes para o Vaticano - ISTOÉ Independente
text: 08/08/2024 - 18:11 O governo da Nicarágua anunciou, nesta quinta-feira (8), que enviou ao Vaticano sete sacerdotes que, segundo a oposição, haviam sido detidos na semana passada, em meio a uma nova onda de prisões de religiosos da Igreja Católica. “Ontem, quarta-feira, 7 de agosto, partiram da Nicarágua para Roma sete sacerdotes nicaraguenses, que chegaram bem e foram recebidos pela Santa Sé”, disse a esposa do presidente Daniel Ortega e vice-presidente, Rosario Murillo, ao ler um comunicado. Os sacerdotes enviados ao Vaticano são Edgar Sacasa, Ulises Vega, Marlon Velázquez, Víctor Godoy, Harvin Torres, Jairo Pravia e Silvio Romero, segundo relatórios do portal digital *El Confidencial*, crítico do governo de Ortega e editado na Costa Rica. Os sete faziam parte de um grupo de 13 religiosos que foram detidos ou colocados em prisão domiciliar pela polícia nicaraguense há uma semana em Matagalpa, no norte do país, de acordo com o Coletivo Nicaragua Nunca Más. Não houve nenhum relatório sobre os outros padres detidos, nem por parte do governo nem da oposição. Ortega e Murillo sustentam que a Igreja apoiou os protestos de 2018 contra o governo, os quais deixaram mais de 300 mortos, segundo a ONU, e considerados por Manágua uma tentativa de golpe de Estado patrocinada por Washington. Murillo chamou os religiosos de “filhos do demônio” ou “agentes do mal” que fazem “terrorismo espiritual”. “Várias paróquias foram cercadas e pelo menos 12 sacerdotes foram detidos arbitrariamente, alguns deles com paradeiro desconhecido e em situação de desaparecimento forçado”, disse o coletivo após as detenções. O governo de Ortega, no entanto, não se referiu às prisões e nem classificou o envio dos sete sacerdotes ao Vaticano como expulsão. – “Crucificados” – O jornalista nicaraguense Emiliano Chamorro, exilado nos Estados Unidos, indicou na rede social X que “a Igreja Católica está sendo crucificada pelo casal ditador”, em referência a Ortega e Murillo. Ele questionou o silêncio dos bispos e cardeais que ainda estão na Nicarágua diante das novas expulsões. “Enquanto a ditadura de Daniel Ortega desterrava 7 dos 13 sacerdotes sequestrados, os bispos da Conferência Episcopal estavam reunidos em Manágua, mas como de costume, não houve uma carta pastoral ou comunicado sobre a situação do país”, acrescentou Chamorro em sua publicação. Há uma semana, um grupo de especialistas das Nações Unidas denunciou que o governo da Nicarágua mantém ataques “sistemáticos” contra a Igreja Católica e outras confissões cristãs desde os protestos de 2018. De abril de 2018 até março de 2024, o grupo constatou “73 casos de prisões arbitrárias de membros da Igreja Católica e de outras confissões cristãs”, embora tenha afirmado que “o número total pode ser ainda maior”. O governo de Ortega libertou em janeiro dois bispos católicos, incluindo Rolando Álvarez, e outros religiosos, e os enviou para Roma.

author: PC
title: 5 Best Open-World Games Where You Play As A Rogue
text: Key Takeaways - Different open-world games allow players to choose their playstyle: guns blazing or stealthy. - Playing as a Rogue can be rewarding in games like The Saboteur, Ghost of Tsushima, and Assassin's Creed Odyssey. - Games like Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor and Skyrim offer stealth mechanics that enhance the Rogue gaming experience. Many [open-world games](https://gamerant.com/tag/open-world/) are known for either having different starting classes that players can choose from or allowing them to make builds that best suit their playstyles. Whether players want to enter buildings guns blazing or take the stealthy approach and opt for sneaking past guards and enemies to reach their destination, there's always a choice to be made. [Related ](/best-open-world-games-alien-ecosystems/) [ Best Open-World Games With Alien Ecosystems ](/best-open-world-games-alien-ecosystems/) Some open-world games place the player in strange alien ecosystems that they can explore. Sometimes, it's even wiser to opt for more than one playstyle, as this allows for more versatility while gaming, and opens up many additional possibilities. Playing as a Rogue in [open-world games](https://gamerant.com/best-open-world-rpgs-without-level-scaling/) is usually a very fun, yet patience-demanding experience that rewards players with being able to smoothly slide past enemy ranks. Here are some of the best open-world games to play as a Rogue. 5 The Saboteur A Mechanic's Quest For Revenge Your comment has not been saved The Saboteur - Sean Devlin embarks on a journey for revenge in the middle of World War 2 - The game has great stealth mechanics, ideal for a Rogue-like experience Focusing on Sean Devlin, an Irish race car mechanic, The Saboteur tells a story of loss, revenge, and conflict right in the middle of World War 2. When Sean and his best friend Jules are cheated out of a race during a Grand Prix by a high-ranking Nazi, the two friends sabotage his car in an attempt to get back at him. However, due to an unfortunate misunderstanding, a series of events will be triggered, giving way to the game's great story. The Saboteur places players right in the middle of combat, implementing a smart color system to identify enemies, and [complex stealth mechanics](https://gamerant.com/best-stealth-action-games/) to avoid detection. 4 Ghost of Tsushima A Visually Stunning Adventure With Tons Of Stealth Mechanics Your comment has not been saved - Platform(s) [PC](/tag/pc/),[PlayStation 4](/tag/ps4/),[PlayStation 5](/tag/ps5/)- Released - July 17, 2020 - Developer(s) [Sucker Punch](/tag/sucker-punch/) - Jin Sakai must recover his homeland from the Mongols - Players can use stealth to sneak into enemy camps and steal any valuables inside them Few games have captured the beauty of feudal Japan, like [Ghost of Tsushima](https://gamerant.com/ghost-of-tsushima-hardest-bosses/). Set in a fictional version of the real-life island of Tsushima, the game follows the story of Jin Sakai, the sole remaining member of Clan Sakai, and a skilled samurai warrior. When his homeland is invaded by Khotun Khan, the leader of the Mongols, Jin is badly wounded and his uncle is captured. This will set off a series of events that deliver an amazing story for players to enjoy. [Related ](/best-open-world-games-play-thief/) [ 6 Best Open-World Games To Play As A Thief ](/best-open-world-games-play-thief/) Some open-world games offer the player the freedom to do whatever they wish, including becoming a thief. The island of Tsushima is beautiful, with vast landscapes, incredibly realistic foliage, and tons of different animals that Jin can interact with, including foxes and songbirds that can lead him to shrines and other points of interest. Ghost of Tsushima's open-world is enormous and exploring it is great fun due to the many possibilities it presents. When Jin approaches enemy camps, players can choose to use stealth to enter them undetected and steal any valuables inside. This makes for a Rogue-like experience that works extremely well with that game's concept. 3 Assassin's Creed Odyssey An Exciting Rogue Story Set In Ancient Greece Your comment has not been saved - Players can choose to enjoy the game either as Kassandra or Alexios - Great combat and stealth mechanics [Assassin's Creed: Odyssey](http://The%2013%20Best%20Outfits%20In%20Assassin's%20Creed%20Odyssey) is a controversial entry in the franchise, as some players love that the developers went for more complex and in-depth RPG mechanics, whereas others weren't fans of the deviation from the classic concept. The game's story is set between 431 and 422 BCE and follows either Alexios or Kassandra, depending on who players pick to progress through the game. As either Alexios or Kassandra, players will have to fight through the game to reunite their broken family and try to eliminate the secret organization known as the Cult of Kosmos. As players would expect from an Assassin's Creed game, this title features great combat mechanics, as well as a lot of stealth that allows them to perform sneak attacks on unsuspecting enemies, and steal money from chests and pouches. The ideal combination for anyone looking to have fun playing as a Rogue in an open-world scenario. 2 Middle-Earth: Shadow Of Mordor A Ranger's Quest To Avenge His Dead Family Your comment has not been saved - The game is set entirely in Mordor - Stealth mechanics and combat aspects that allow for gameplay as a Rogue The works of J.R.R. Tolkien are so vast and well crafted, that, even after more than 50 years since his passing, they're still inspiring a nearly endless set of films, TV shows, and games. Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor is set between The Hobbit and [The Lord of the Rings](https://gamerant.com/games-best-lotr-mods/) trilogy and follows the story of Talion, a ranger who loses his family and his own life and is later resurrected by a powerful wraith by the name of Celebrimbor. [Related ](/best-open-world-games-to-play-as-mercenary/) [ 7 Best Open-World Games To Play As A Mercenary ](/best-open-world-games-to-play-as-mercenary/) No every game has clear cut morality, some allow the player to take on the role of a mercenary and sell their sword to the highest bidder. As Talion and Celebrimbor explore the dark lands of Mordor, they will encounter a countless number of orcs and other enemies that they'll have to defeat to progress through the story. Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor serves as the prequel to [Middle-earth: Shadow of War](https://screenrant.com/tag/middle-earth-shadow-of-war/), and it helped establish the wonderful game mechanics the franchise has become known for. With chained attacks, stealth exploration, and aerial strikes, Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor has many elements that will allow players to have a great time as Rogues. 1 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim Making A Rogue Build Is Very Fun Your comment has not been saved - Platform(s) [PC](/tag/pc/),[PlayStation 3](/tag/ps3/),[PlayStation 4](/tag/ps4/),[PlayStation 5](/tag/ps5/),[Nintendo Switch](/tag/switch/),[Xbox 360](/tag/xbox-360/),[Xbox One](/tag/xbox-one/),[Xbox Series X](/tag/xbox-series-x/),[Xbox Series S](/tag/xbox-series-s/)- Released - November 11, 2011 - Developer(s) - Bethesda Game Studios - There are potions, armors, and skills that allow players to remain undetected by most NPCs - Players can steal valuables from chests, guards, and merchant stands Lastly, there's [The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim](https://gamerant.com/skyrim-ultima-wishlist-wanted-features/). This game not only revolutionized what players thought RPGs could do back in the day, but also set a precedent for any titles that followed it. Unlike other games on this list, Skyrim not only presents players with game mechanics that allow them to play as Rogues by using stealth, but also offers them different potions, armor, and skills to be able to walk past most enemies undetected. The lockpicking mechanics are also extremely fun, and if players spend enough skill points on them, they'll be able to open any chest in seconds. Players can also steal from merchants and pickpocket guards, which isn't always recommended, but can often be a great source of income. All in all, Skyrim presents one of the best open worlds to make a Rogue build and play as one. [More4:14 ](/historical-settings-not-used-open-world-games/) [ 6 Historical Settings That Still Haven't Been Used In An Open-World games ](/historical-settings-not-used-open-world-games/) Open-world games have traveled through history, but they have yet to touch these settings.

author: Dawn Timmeney
title: Trees, power lines down after potent storm system rages across Delaware County | FOX 29 Philadelphia
text:
Storms ravage Delaware County, toppling trees, taking out power An early evening potent storm system blew through the region, dumping copious amounts of rain. At the height of the storm, winds were gusting up to 50 mph, bringing down trees and power lines.
The Brief An early evening potent storm system blew through the region, dumping copious amounts of rain. At the height of the storm, winds were gusting up to 50 mph, bringing down trees and power lines. NEWTOWN SQUARE, Pa. - Delaware County was not spared from the early evening storm system that saw a variety of issues, including heavy rain and damaging wind gusts that took down trees and power lines.
What we know:
Daniel McCarthey arrived to his Newtown Square home from work to a large tree down in the front yard and no power.
His wife, who was at home at the time, texted him pictures just before 2 p.m.
McCarthy said his wife heard a loud rumble of thunder and then a loud bang and went outside to find the tree down.
What they're saying:
"I was like, ‘What does she need, Oh my god, what's that?’" McCarthy described what happened. "Lightning struck the tree and, fortunately, it fell away from the house, not towards the house."
He added, "PECO was quick to respond. Police were quick to respond. Everyone got out real quick."
Dig deeper:
The couple just renovated the home and only moved in in January. They are actually relieved they are only dealing with no power.
McCarthy said, "If I get it back by this time tomorrow, I'll be a happy camper. What can you do, really?"
Big picture view:
Neighbor Stephen Fay is taking the outage in stride, but admits he was a little worried about all the wires on the ground, "So we have a wire that's on our driveway. We're not seeing any sparks or anything, just to double check there's no worries about the power being on but talked to the guys. Power was off so everything is safe."
In all 11 homes are in the dark, with PECO crews on site working to restore service.
